data.text:
Whatever one thinks of actors and Hollywood as a whole, and there’s a lot to ponder about the industry and its members, there’s no denying that glamour, prestige and wealth aside, the hallmarks of the profession, its members are still just people are trying to get through various personal problems and challenges. For some, the profession is a means of satisfying their vanity, desire for wealth and fame, while for others, like Kelly McGillis, Hollywood was the natural ending of a journey that began as an escape from a difficult life.

Kelly McGillis is known for her work in a number of films, most notably Top Gun and The Accused . She is one of Hollywood’s most famous living actresses. Who is she? Find out more about them by reading below.

Kelly McGillis’ Biography

Kelly was born the son of Dr. Donald Manson McGillis and Virginia Joan on July 9, 1957 in Newport Beach, California. However, she grew up in Los Angeles, where she received extensive acting training. Starting out at the Pacific Conservatory for the Performing Arts at Allan Hancock College and then moving across the country to attend the world-renowned Julliard School of Fine Arts in New York City. Kelly Mcgillis graduated as an actress in 1983, graduating from Julliard with a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree.

The same year that she graduated, McGillis starred as Reuben, Reuben marking her film debut. It was the culmination of a passion for acting that began as an escape from a life fraught with the misery of loneliness and being overweight. In her debut as Geneva Spofford in Reuben, Reuben furthered Kelly McGillis’ reputation as a very talented actress. After the film, she landed her second full-length role as Rachel Lapp in Witness, a 1985 film co-directed with Harrison Ford. Her performance and the film earned her Golden Globe and BAFTA nominations, the first of a successful career.

Before starring in what would be her next biggest film that would go on to become an icon whose greatness spans generations, Kelly starred in a number of television projects, mostly credited for TV movies like A Life To Live , Private Sessions and Sweet Revenge . In 1986 she starred in Top Gunand played Charlotte Blackwood alongside Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer. Kelly’s acting skills made her a studio, casting director and director of some of the best films in the business. This recognition put her in the enviable position of working alongside other talented actors who have gone on to become big names in the industry such as Jeff Daniels and Timothy Hotton.
